caption: Absolutely amazing food here. We found this place randomly near our hotel when we were visiting. It was incredibly unassuming given its location near the mall and train station. However, the food was incredible. We decided to go the set menu route, and were so glad we did. The duck was out of this world, and the dessert was so delicious. I would highly recommend giving this place a visit!

Excellent food, service and wine. This place was steps from our hotel, and walking by a couple of times seeing the quality of food we knew we had to try it. Was definitely worth it and a refreshing experience compared to the touristy places where the food is often mediocre.
I ordered the Lamb, it was really great! Especially the service! The person who helped me speaks great English and amazingly friendly and helpful! I would come here again if I visit Paris!
Really tasty French food and reasonable price too. Everything we had tasted great. Would highly recommend the beef tartare and snails.
The food was delicious: we had a spectacular lunch of the burger, and the steaks. Waitress was nice and it was a very cute little restaurant.

Great relation quality-price. I went there for lunch and profited from the lunch offer: 19 euros for 2 courses which is the cheapest price u can find in Paris. The entree was enjoyable with snails and 2 type of seafood. The other entree was an average chicken nugget style but still well cooked. The main course was a real surprise: a big portion full of meat veggies and flavor.
Really nice, local feeling food. Despite it being quite busy, the staff did an admirable job of keeping things moving.

Service and atmosphere were fantastic. Food was also good but I think you can get better authentic French food elsewhere.  We got the escargots (7.5/10), chicken (7.5/10), squid tentacles (8/10) and steak (7/10).

La Fresque is a must! You must experience the quaint atmosphere. You must experience the amazing service. You must enjoy the imaginative and delicious dishes! We had creme de Foie Gras and ceviche de Bar aux agrumes to start. The ceviche was very special, not chopped up fish ends, instead a complete, gorgeous fillet, fantastically seasoned, not too acidic. Truly a joy! The Magret de Canard sauce miel aux épices with duo de purée (pommes-de-terre et carottes) was absolutely delicious. The hatching of the skin rendered the fat and made the skin crispy while maintaining the tenderness of the breast. And the sauce was a thing of mastery, so light and slightly sweet with wonderful spices. Highly recommend this wonderful little establishment! Bravo!
Really good dishes, at reasonable prices. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Probably the best restaurant we visited during our 5 day visit in Paris. I totally recommend it.
The duck breast is awesome! A must try when you visit Paris. The best meal I have had here! There is no English menu but the staff speak fluent English so no worries

THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!!! First dinner in Paris and this neighborhood spot came highly recommended by the hotel staff as a simple French restaurant for dinner - it did not disappoint. Service was great - even though we speak no English, and the food was spot on. Steak frites with a chocolate cake/tort for dessert. So good. Drinks were good also. Seems to be a gray ever changing menu. The vibe was very cool with active conversations in many different languages. Highly recommended for a dinner in the Les Halles area.
The sausage with mash potatoes is super good and the atmosphere is great!

Been coming here for a while. It's pretty inconsistent, but usually a 4 out of 5. Menu changes regularly so here is a snapshot of the last time I went: oeuf parfait with mushrooms were tasty, boar with pasta was flavorful as well.

This place has fantastic food. The choices on the menu have a nice variety. The place was packed with locals.. always a great sign you are in a good restaurant. The staff is very friendly and hospitable even with a packed restaurant. Highly recommend and will be coming back again!

Great dinner, very nice service in a lovely area. Everything we ordered was great from the salads to smoked salmon with mango and the fish main course. Nice wine list and a pretty decent glass of wine option. It's casual and relaxed great for a night out with friends or family.
Food was so good and staff was friendly. Came in pretty late so they were out of some of the menu items but went with their suggestions which was such a good decision! Definitely recommend

Nice place to eat when at Chatelet! Menus are not bad at all and food is well presented and delicious. Meat is well cooked and of good quality. The menu changes daily, i think that is nice, of course having some platters that are always available.

Lost in the heart of Châtelet Les Halles among tourists restaurants... it’s unexpected... It was just  delicious , simple, creative not expensive at all , homemade and so tasty. I have enjoyed my lunch and I am sure about one thing : it’s that I will come back . Thank you for receiving us and for welcoming us the way you did

Excellent food, fair prices with very friendly English speaking staff. There is an outside seating area for people watching. But if you prefer a break from the humid Paris weather, there is indoor seating with AC available as well. VISA accepted. I highly recommend the duck breast.

Visited first time in 2016; a second visit in 2018. Food is wonderful, duck breast is a winner in 2018 visit; while lamb leg was the winner in 2016. Dishes are less than 20euro.  Snail has improved a lot.  Definitely worth the money。  台灣朋友，鴨胸鮮美，羊膝軟嫩。值得嘗試。

Not only was the food great and a lot of fun to eat but the prices are a lot lower than a lot of the bistros I’ve been to so far. We had a very nice waiter who helped me order with a bit of English and he also made an excellent wine recommendation for us. I had the roast lamb and it was very good. They had quite a few meat dishes on the menu. The table next to us ordered the beer tartare and it looked delicious.

I found this place by accident and was pleasantly surprised. Rustic interior, not too expensive, good service, although a bit slow. For entrée I had the octoposus a la provençale and got main I had the magret de canard and have to say it was delicious. The meat was ful of flavor and nively roasted, see photo. For desert I had the mi cuit au chocolat and although it was tasty, I would have preferred for the chocolate to be more liquid. Overall it was a nice experience, definitely recommend to visit.

Had the best baguette in France and what's more in a restaurant. Got to know they bought it from a nearby bakery. The food were delicious. Pork check is tender and have the char taste. Swordfish steak doneness just right. Will be back.
Delicious plates. They are really known for their entrecôte. They have a lot of table inside, do not be discouraged if you see the terrasse full. A bit noisy in the inside.

Dinner time was very busy, fortunately we reserve before. The service is very good (I think the best during our stay in Paris). They open at 7pm for dinner and better do reservation. Escargot and foie gras as a starter. Duck confit is above my expectation, very nice. Cheese cake and tiramisu very smooth and not too sweet, very good for me.

Magret de Canard cooked to perfection followed by Moelleux à la Chataigne swished down with a glass of red wine. La Fresque has become an instant Paris favourite. Thank you for the recommendation, Mr. P.B. I’ll be back to try some of the other dishes on the menu!!!

If you are looking for a great French bistrot in this crowded and noisy area, this is the place! Menu offers a small selection of daily fresh dishes, quality in the plate for a very fair price! This might become my new « cantine » in this area. Recommended 100%!

This was the best meal I had in Paris BY FAR!  We ordered: - escargot - entrecôte - beef tartare  Everything was amazing! The baguette was some of the best bread I’ve ever had. Seriously no complaints.  The service was great as well. The owner was nice enough to give us free doses of a digestif at the end of our meal!! just such genuinely kind service.  I will definitely be returning when I find myself in Paris again :)

Nice cafe with good fresh food. Had the asparagus, cote de boeuf, steak and fries and Greek salad. All nicely put together. Followed by chocolate fondant and cheesecake. Brilliant! Great meal for just 60€.
Friendly staff. Great value. I had the Cod fillet, Yuzu butter, Leeks, Turnip, Endive & Steam Apple. €14 for plate you can add dessert for €3 but for solo traveler meal with free bread was enough.
Since everybody was heading to the influencee famous place round the corner, we checked out la fresque. The food was heavenly and the staff amazing - see for yourself
Very good food. The tables are a bit small but still OK if nobody sits right next to you. They also have nice cocktails and desserts. Very friendly staff.
Very local French restaurant and good food. The staff was friendly. I was too full to try the dessert, but the Tiramisu did look delicious. The menu was in French, luckily Google translate helps.

Had a lovely meal here with our three children. The food was delicious and the staff were friendly and helpful, even with our very basic French as a family visiting from UK! Would recommend and visit again.

In the middle of the city, but rather affordable. Good value for money! Shared escargots and foie gras as starter, lamb for main and tiramisu as dessert. All were good. Staff is very friendly and speaks English if needed. Wine on the card is quite good and affordable.

Food was Great! I had the octopus in chimichurri sauce for my entree and the beef penne pasta for the main course and it was Delicious! Great ambience and loved the staff especially Victoria from NY, who helped us understand the menu since we don't speak French! She was truly the BEST.
Amazing waitstaff, awesome atmosphere, and excellent food at a very fair price. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
